item.title: Scanning the OpenShift Internal Registry
item.description: Did you know that you can scan the internal OpenShift registry for security issues? Read on to find out how.
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Scanning Quay.io private repositories for CVEs
item.description: A quick guide on how to integrate a Kubernetes-native security platform with quay.io private repositories
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Automating application control
item.description: Automation allows organisations to scale security workflows across hybrid cloud environments. In this article I take a closer look at automating application control, and how you can use Ansible roles to create reusable automation content.
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Maintaining a knowledge balance
item.description: What's the difference between institutional and industry knowledge, and what can you do to bring these into balance?
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Kubernetes-native security and least surprise
item.description: What does it mean to be "Kubernetes-native"? And what does Kubernetes-native security look like?
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Application control and integrity checks
item.description: Injecting integrity checks to application control processes is a winning security combination. Application control allows you to specify that only certain processes can execute on a system - but how do you know they are the right processes? How can you ensure that the code that you want to execute is the code that actually executes?
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Application control for everyone
item.description: Application control seems to be one of those elusive security controls that organisations spend years chasing. How can we validate which processes are authorised to run on a system, and then enforce this?
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Open source threat intelligence and SELinux
item.description: How do you protect your threat intelligence sharing platform from compromise? Read on to learn how SELinux and podman can support a containerised MISP deployment.
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)

item.title: Compliance is mislabelled
item.description: Compliance evokes images of checking boxes. The real purpose of IT system compliance is risk migitation, and it probably just needs a better name
item.author: dev@stb.id.au (Shane Boulden)
